DOC.brief_summary: This study design determine ED90 single dose phenylephrine treatment spinal induced hypotension parturients present elective CD . The ED90 effective dose 90 % subject `` positive '' response phenylephrine . The primary outcome measure ED90 bolus phenylephrine . Secondary outcome include need additional vasopressor , glycopyrolate treat bradycardia , presence hypertension follow administration phenylephrine .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Nonemergent cesarean delivery plan regional anesthesia ( i.e . elective planned cesarean delivery malposition , patient choice , cervical pelvic disproportion , previous cesarean delivery diagnosis require predetermine cesarean delivery ) 2 . American Society Anesthesia physical status class I & II ( ASA I Healthy , ASA II mild control systemic disease , eg . control essential hypertension ) 3 . Age ≥ 18 year ( Standard within obstetrical literature ) 4 . Term gestational age 5 . Englishspeaking 1 . Morbid Obesity ( Body Mass Index ≥ 45 kg/m2 ) ( Morbidly obese parturients require dose local anesthetic less standardized dose study , typically exaggerated response vasopressor , blood pressure cuff occasionally need replaced intraarterial catheter due limitation size ) 2 . Height < 5 ' 0 '' ( Women < 5 ' 0 '' likely require dose local anesthetic less standardized dose study ) 3 . Laboring woman 4 . Urgent emergency cesarean delivery 5 . Severe hypertensive disease pregnancy define systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) > 160mmHg , diastolic blood pressure ( DBP ) > 110mmHg and/or require antihypertensive treatment associate significant proteinuria 6 . Severe maternal cardiac disease 7 . Diabetes type I 8 . Subjects monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOI 's ) tricyclic antidepressants 9 . Fetal anomaly 10 . Failed spinal anesthesia 11 . Subject enrollment another study involve study medication within 30 day CD 12 . Any physical psychiatric condition may impair ability cooperate study data collection
